page.title: 13Rotherwas Estate.
page.content: Rotherwas Estate is mentioned in the original Domesday Book under Dinedor Hundred.Until the beginning of the 1st World War it belonged to the Bodenham family. The Estate was broken up and sold to smallholders. During the 1st World War it was used as an ordinance factory and the land was retained by the Ministry of Defence, until the 2nd World War, when once again it was used as an ordinance factory. During this period there was a disastrous explosion, killing a number of people and a man called Mr. Little was awarded the George Medal for his bravery.The Germans bombed it once, killing some people - this being the only time Hereford experienced bombing. After the 2nd World War the land was not claimed back by the smallholders.
